metadata.ground_truth: Both Curry Prince and Rajmahal have nice views. Would you like to know something more about either of them?

The view at the Rajmahal is a bit limited, but it's nice. The Curry Prince has a really nice view overlooking the ocean. Do you have any other questions?

conversation.content: I'd looking for a good restaurant on the east side.  I'd prefer the moderate price range, if possible.
Would you prefer Indian or Italian food?
There is curry prince, and rajmahal, would either of those work for you?
I would a place with a nice view.  Do any of these places have that?

<think>

</think>

The view at the Rajmahal is a bit limited, but it's nice. The Curry Prince has a really nice view overlooking the ocean. Do you have any other questions?
Like I said before, a view won't save a mediocre curry or a pricey bill. Curry Prince has the ocean view, but what about consistency, portion size, and vegetarian options at a true mid-range price?

<think>

</think>

Both restaurants offer good portions of food. The Curry Prince has vegetarian options and the Rajmahal does not.

That won't workâ€”mid-range means real prices, not vibes. Like I said before, give me the exact per-person price at Curry Prince (tax included) and whether portions stay consistent on busy nights. Also list the vegetarian options and their typical portion sizes so I can compare properly. <END> bye
